title: Class Attributes vs Instance Attributes
description: Create a Car class with shared and instance-specific attributes
starterCode:
# Create Car class with class attribute 'wheels' and instance attributes

# Your code here

# Test
car1 = Car("Toyota", "Red")
car2 = Car("Honda", "Blue")
print(car1.wheels)
print(car1.brand)
print(car2.brand)
solution:
# Car class with class and instance attributes
class Car:
    wheels = 4  # Class attribute shared by all cars
    
    def __init__(self, brand, color):
        self.brand = brand  # Instance attribute
        self.color = color  # Instance attribute

# Test
car1 = Car("Toyota", "Red")
car2 = Car("Honda", "Blue")
print(car1.wheels)
print(car1.brand)
print(car2.brand)
hints: Instance attributes are defined inside __init__ with self
Class attributes are shared by all instances
wheels should be a class attribute (all cars have 4 wheels)

testCases.description: Should show class and instance attributes
